title: Reason: Credential is not supported if the CORS header 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin' is '*'
summary: The CORS request was attempted with the credentials flag set, but the server is configured using the wildcard ("*") as the value of Access-Control-Allow-Origin, which doesn't allow the use of credentials.
short_title: Reason: Credential is not supported if the CORS header 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin' is '*'

parents.title: Reason: Credential is not supported if the CORS header 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin' is '*'

pageTitle: Reason: Credential is not supported if the CORS header 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin' is '*' - HTTP | MDN
